title: Software Engineering Co-op
location: Boston, MA, USA
targeted_major:
College of Engineering/Robotics
College of Engineering/Computer System Engineering
College of Engineering/Computer Engineering
Khoury College of Computer Sciences/Computer Science
description:
This software engineering co-op will be focused on integration of next generation tools surrounding Medtronic's new minimally invasive surgical robot, Hugo.  Read this article to learn more about the system: https://www.massdevice.com/medtronic-finally-unveils-its-new-robot-assisted-surgery-system/ This co-op will be embedded in a scrum team with other developers and will be working with C++ and embedded systems daily.
Specific Job Functions:
-Contribute to development and testing of existing applications
-Develop real-time logging applications for embedded systems
-Automate existing workflows to enhance the development process
-Generate ideas for the next project in the surgical robotics space
  Required Experience:
-Software integration of different rate data streams
-Software logging
-Strong Object Oriented Design programming skills, C++ knowledge strongly preferred
-Git or comparable version control experience
  Preferred Experience: 
-Basic knowledge of robotics, kinematics, and controls.
-Experience with publish/subscribe messaging such as ROS.
-Experience with various networking protocols.
-Experience with database architecture.
-Previous experience working with Agile software development tools like Bitbucket, Jira (Trello), and Confluence.
-Python

location: Boston, MA, USA

College of Engineering/Computer Engineering

Khoury College of Computer Sciences/Computer Science
description:
Experience
Some experience in either full-stack/backend, ML/AI, data science, or embedded/robotics.
Willingness to learn, challenge themselves, and grow their own skills.
Responsibilities
- Assist in building backend systems, APIs, and core business logic under guidance from senior engineers.
- Support development of frontend interfaces for customer data analytics and machine HMI tools.
- Help implement and test user authentication, device security, and cybersecurity features.
- Contribute to integrating backend, frontend, and hardware signal pathways to ensure reliable platform performance.
- Participate in troubleshooting and testing during engineering integration and software release cycles.
- Assist in data collection, cleaning, and preprocessing for machine learning model development.
- Support experimentation and evaluation of ML models on real-world datasets under supervision.
- Help profile and optimize ML model inference speed and accuracy.
- Contribute to documenting ML workflows and integration steps with software and hardware teams.
- Participate in data analysis to identify trends and support ideation for new products and model improvements.

title: Software Engineering Co-op
location: Boston, MA, USA
targeted_major:
Khoury College of Computer Sciences/Data Science
Khoury College of Computer Sciences/Computer Science
description:
Maven AGI is an enterprise AI platform on a mission to unleash business artificial general intelligence (AGI), starting with customer service. Founded in July 2023 by executives from HubSpot, Google and Stripe, Maven builds conversational AI agents capable of delivering accurate, autonomous support that delights customers at scale.
Our platform unifies fragmented systems, integrates knowledge and personalization sources, and enables intelligent actions - all without costly system changes. We’re laying the foundation for a future where our technology handles complex tasks, allowing people to focus on what they do best: creative problem-solving, relationship building, and delivering exceptional customer experiences.
We’ve started by reimagining the enterprise customer experience with a support use case. We believe that today’s support experience is broken: slow and painful for customers, and expensive and human capital intensive for companies.
We are building Maven to deliver better, cheaper support, for both end users and agents. With recent advancements in Generative AI, it is now possible to deliver delightful customer experiences at a fraction of today’s cost.
Job Description:
As a Software Engineering Co-op at Maven AGI, you will primarily work alongside Senior and Staff level engineers, assisting with real feature development to support our customers. You will gain practice experience by working on critical projects for business success. This work will likely involve:
-Developing and improving AI quality observability systems
-Enhancing Reliability and scalability of our platform
-Ensuring data quality and efficient data processing
-Contributing to API development and integration
Knowledge, Skills, Abilities:
We're looking for candidates with a passion for software development and a drive to learn. Desired skills include:
-Experience working in Java development, with a solid understanding of Object Oriented Design and Best Practices
-Familiarity with Spring Boot and microservices architecture
- Experience with version control systems (Git)
- Strong analytical and problem-solving skills with a passion for addressing
complex technical challenges.
- Excellent written and verbal communication skills, facilitating effective
collaboration with cross-functional teams.
- Willingness to learn and adapt to new technologies and programming
languages as necessary.
Qualifications
- Pursuing a Bachelors in Computer Science, Software Engineering, or a
related field
- Prior internship or co-op experience preferred
- Basic understanding of APIs
- Interest in building large-scale business AI enterprise applications
- Work Environment: Hybrid with a minimum of 2 days onsite in our Boston
office
- Growing startup with many future growth opportunities
- Be exposed to a world-class team of Engineers from Google, Meta, Amazon,
and Stripe, and is supported by executives & Advisors from OpenAI, Google,
HubSpot, and Stripe.

title: First-year Engineering Technical Specialist
company: First Year Engineering Learning & Innovation Center
location: Boston, MA, USA
targeted_major: College of Engineering
description:
The position is responsible for assisting in the operation of the First-Year Engineering Learning & Innovation Center (FYELIC) by collaborating with Management Staff to ensure the smooth execution of daily operations. This includes overseeing and maintaining machines and equipment, supporting faculty in instructional activities, and assisting students in utilizing the center's resources for coursework and independent projects. Additionally, the role involves developing and delivering OnShape training sessions to enhance students' technical skills, facilitate project development, and provide support for computational problem-solving within engineering applications. The position requires active engagement in fostering an innovative and collaborative learning environment, guiding students in hands-on engineering practices, and
contributing to the overall efficiency and functionality of the center.
Qualifications:
Must be an undergraduate student majoring in Engineering who has not previously completed a co-op.
Experience with programming languages and design software.
Knowledge of makerspace tools such as 3D printers, laser cutters, and small hand tools.
Previous experience working in a makerspace or engineering lab environment is a plus.
Strong problem-solving skills, attention to detail, and the ability to work collaboratively in a team setting.
Job Duties:
Makerspace Supervision & Student Support
●Provide general supervision of the FYELIC makerspace and academic support center to
ensure a safe and productive learning environment.
●Work as a liaison between FYELIC’s Management, student-workers, and students to provide consistent and valuable supervisory coverage and assist in enforcing safety and operational protocols.
●Facilitate the student project design and development process, offering technical guidance
and troubleshooting assistance.
Assist students, student-workers, and faculty with the proper use of equipment, tools, and software to support coursework and research initiatives.
Maintain an organized and well-stocked workspace by assisting in the procurement and
inventory management of supplies and materials.
Create engaging social media content for outreach to students
Strive to make FYELIC spaces more accessible, user-friendly, and safe while emphasizing the engineering design process for students and their needs.
Training & Documentation Development
Design and deliver OnShape training sessions tailored to engineering applications, equipping students with essential computational and coding skills.
Support the department’s pedagogical shift by assisting in the development of instructional workshops and training programs.
Aid in the documentation and refinement of best practices for FYELIC operations, ensuring clear and accessible guidelines for users.
Update and maintain standard operating procedures (SOPs) for equipment usage, safety protocols, and troubleshooting processes.
Develop supplemental documentation to support student learning in engineering design and prototyping, including materials for Cornerstone courses.
Assist in the training and onboarding of new student workers, ensuring they are equipped with the necessary knowledge and skills to support FYELIC operations effectively.
This role provides a valuable opportunity for students interested in hands-on engineering education, makerspace management, and technical instruction while gaining practical experience in engineering design, fabrication, and programming."

title: Software Engineering Co-op
location: Boston, MA, USA
targeted_major:
College of Engineering
College of Engineering/Information Systems
College of Engineering/Internet of Things
description:
Company name: getIntro
Job title: Software Engineering Co-op
Physical company location: 55 Court St, 2nd Floor, Boston, MA 02203
Term length: Spring 2026 with option to continue through Summer 2026
Start date: 12/15/2025
End date: 8/31/2026
Role type: Hybrid (~50% in person)
Pay rate: $2,000 - $3,000 per month
About getIntro
At getIntro, we’re reimagining how enterprise healthcare sales work—from the ground up. Our AI agents don’t just automate tasks; they help sales teams think and act strategically, focusing only on what truly matters: building real human relationships with the right decision-makers. The result? less noise, faster sales cycles, and revenue that lands sooner.
We’re a small team of experienced founders who’ve built and exited successful healthtech and AI companies. We’re tackling one of the hardest problems in B2B sales: turning unstructured signals and relationship data into intelligent guidance that actually drives action.
If you love moving fast and solving complex technical challenges that have real-world business impact—and want to build alongside people who’ve done it before—this is your chance to get in early and help shape something foundational.
About You
You are energized by early-stage startups
You are impatient and blazingly fast
You love solving hard problems and love to experiment
You have interest in agentic AI
You think creatively to find simple solutions to hard problems
You take ownership and get things done without much handholding
You are fearless and jump in to help wherever needed
About the Role
Able to work a minimum of 20 hours per week
Working across the technology stack
Building high-quality semantic search
Building with agentic frameworks
Managing large data sets and graph data
Delivering commercial/production quality code

title: Software Engineering Co-op (Full-Stack)
location: Boston, MA, USA
targeted_major:
College of Engineering/Computer Engineering
Khoury College of Computer Sciences/Data Science
Khoury College of Computer Sciences/Computer Science
description:
Software Engineering Co-op (Full-Stack) –

Location: Kendall Sq., Cambridge, MA (In-Person Required)
Start Date: Spring 2026 
Duration: Full semester (with potential to extend)
Company Overview
Thinkstruct is an MIT delta v and Link Ventures-backed legal tech startup reimagining how patent law is practiced using AI. Our platform accelerates claim mapping, prior art search, and patent prosecution using custom-trained models, intuitive interfaces, and scalable infrastructure. We're a
small, fast-moving team combining technical depth with domain expertise and we’re working at the intersection of software, AI, and legal workflows.
The Opportunity
We’re looking for a full-time Software Engineering Co-op to join our core team and help build the future of legal infrastructure. You’ll work directly with our CTO (MIT CS + AI) and CEO (MIT Data Science) on building our first live products. This is a
rare chance to get full exposure to what it takes to build a startup from the ground up.
You'll work across the stack and gain experience in product design, user testing, and rapid iteration. You’ll ship code that gets used by real lawyers and researchers.
What You’ll Work On
● Frontend Development: Build and refine features in our React/Next.js interface to support document analysis, comparison tools, and visualizations
● Backend Algorithms: Implement and optimize algorithms for patent claim matching, NLP pipelines, and semantic similarity scoring
● APIs and Infrastructure: Help scale our Python/Flask API layer, integrate with vector databases, and automate deployment pipelines
● Data & Storage: Work with PostgreSQL, Redis, and vector stores to structure and retrieve patent data efficiently
● User Testing: Collaborate with the product team to rapidly prototype features and gather real user feedback
Preferred Skills
● Proficiency in Python and JavaScript/TypeScript
● Experience with React, Flask, or Next.js
● Familiarity with SQL databases, REST APIs, and basic DevOps tools
● Interest in AI, NLP, or legal/policy tech (not required, but a plus!)
● Strong debugging, version control (Git), and testing practices
● Curiosity, self-direction, and comfort working in ambiguity
Qualifications
● Current Northeastern undergraduate student in Computer Science, Software Engineering, Data Science, or related fields
● Prior internship or class project experience in full-stack development
● Able to commit to a full-time schedule (32–40 hrs/week) during a semester
● Based in Boston or able to commute to our Cambridge location in Kendall Square
What You’ll Gain
● Exposure to cutting-edge AI workflows (LLMs, RAG, semantic search, agentic AI)
● Experience working directly with a founding team of engineers and domain experts
● A portfolio of production-grade software you’ve shipped
● Opportunities to learn more about startups in Boston and pathways to launching your own company
How to Apply
Send your resume, GitHub (or project samples), and a short note on why you're interested to team@thinkstruct.com.
Bonus: tell us about a feature or idea you think could make patent law
better.

title: Electrical Co-op
location: Boston, MA, USA
targeted_major:
College of Engineering
College of Engineering/Telecommunications-System Management
College of Engineering/Telecommunication Networks
College of Engineering/Electrical Engineering
College of Engineering/Electrical and Computer Engineering
description:
Start designing tomorrow’s future!
Buro Happold has an exciting opportunity for a collaborative and enthusiastic Electrical Co-op to join our welcoming and diverse workplace culture in Boston! 
As an Electrical Co-op, you will work with some of the brightest minds in the industry, contributing to unique and innovative projects that inspire awe, transform communities, and help to combat climate change.  
Here at Buro Happold, expect the exceptional.
From the projects you will work on to the clients we work with. From career-defining opportunities to an inclusive and diverse practice where we all contribute to a more equitable world. From our reputation to our relationships. Wherever your Buro Happold career takes you, it’ll be anything but ordinary.
Your next role
Join us and be surrounded by exceptional opportunities in an environment alive with innovation and possibility. Your new team has a willingness and curiosity to see possibility and potential in everything – from the most iconic projects to our everyday conversations. 
Learn more about Electrical Engineering at Buro Happold
Your key duties: As an Electrical Co-op, you will collaborate with other engineers to develop creative, energy-efficient buildings that provide aesthetics to their physical surroundings and utility to their occupants. In return, we’ll help you meet your goals, respect your ideas, and foster your creativity, collaboration, and innovation. 
Undertake electrical engineering building services design and calculations (using software and knowledge to verify robust calculations such as Design Master and SKM)
Embrace the latest technologies to improve performance and sustainability
Using Revit, prepare technical drawings, schedules, and reports
Analyze load to determine system sizing, and assign circuitry for power and lighting devices
Your skills and experience
This role will require the following:
Currently pursuing a Bachelor's or Master's degree in Electrical Engineering or Architectural Engineering
Coursework in electrical power systems design, control systems, and/or building systems design
Interest in the electrical engineering industry with an emphasis on the power side of the discipline
Academic research, coursework, or other experience with alternative energy systems and other technologies new to the construction industry preferred
Familiarity with BIM modelling software, such as Revit, AutoCAD
Internship experience at engineering related firm preferred, and proven interest in the built environment
Ability to communicate thoughts and technical ideas in an accessible manner
Eagerness to learn and work as part of a multidisciplinary team
What we offer:

Currently pursuing a Bachelor's degree in Mechanical, Civil, Sanitary, Environmental, or Architectural Engineering
Coursework in mechanical/HVAC design, heat transfer, fluid dynamics, and/or thermodynamics
Familiarity with BIM modelling software, such as Revit and AutoCAD
Internship experience at engineering related firm preferred, and proven interest in the built environment
Ability to communicate thoughts and technical ideas in an accessible manner
Eagerness to learn and work as part of a multidisciplinary team
Learn more about our office locations
Ready for something a little less ordinary? 
Apply now to start your career journey with us.

location:
Washington, DC, USA
New York, NY, USA
Boston, MA, USA
Chicago, IL, USA
targeted_major: College of Engineering
description:
Start designing tomorrow’s future!
Buro Happold is looking for a dedicated and collaborative Graduate Plumbing & Fire Protection Engineer to join our inclusive and welcoming team!
Here at Buro Happold, expect the exceptional.
From the projects you will work on to the clients we work with. From career-defining opportunities to an inclusive and diverse practice where we all contribute to a more equitable world. From our reputation to our relationships. Wherever your Buro Happold career takes you, it’ll be anything but ordinary.
Your next role
Join us and be surrounded by exceptional opportunities in an environment alive with innovation and possibility. Your new team has a willingness and curiosity to see possibility and potential in everything – from the most iconic projects to our everyday conversations. 
Learn more about Fire and Plumbing Protection Engineering at Buro Happold
Your key duties: As a Graduate Plumbing and Fire Protection Engineer you will assist in the design, documentation, and coordination of plumbing and fire protection systems for various building types. The role is ideal for recent graduates looking to gain hands-on experience in building systems engineering.
Support the development of plumbing and fire protection system designs under the guidance of senior engineers.
Prepare construction drawings from schematic design through construction administration.
Perform calculations using standard engineering software and tools.
Conduct field surveys to document existing conditions and observe progress during construction.
Participate in interdisciplinary coordination with architectural, structural, electrical, mechanical and civil engineering teams.
Assist in client meetings and value engineering sessions.
Contribute to quality assurance and constructability reviews.
Help develop discipline specific standards and specifications.
Ensure service and project work are carried out to an excellent standard and quality within agreed deadlines and budget.
Your skills and experience
This role will require the following:
Bachelor's or Master's degree in Mechanical, Fire Protection, Civil, Sanitary, Environmental, or Architectural Engineering.
Coursework in mechanical design, heat transfer, thermodynamics, and fluid hydraulics/dynamics.
Awareness of building, plumbing and fire codes, (IPC, NFPA).
Proficiency with BIM modelling software, such as Revit and AutoCAD.
Internship experience at engineering related firm preferred, and proven interest in the built environment and sustainable design.
Ability to communicate thoughts and technical ideas in an accessible manner.
Eagerness to learn and work as part of a multidisciplinary team.
What we offer:
Salary range of $73,000 to $80,000.This will be determined based on factors such as geographic location, skills, education, and/or experience
Generous benefits package
Annual discretionary bonus
Generous PTO (4 weeks) in addition to 10 paid holidays
401k with company match
Hybrid working & summer hours
Reimbursement for certain professional licenses and associated renewals and exam fees
Connection to global network of experts on the forefront of industry initiatives
Access to wide ranging learning and development opportunities
Be a part of supporting our diverse company culture through open engagement with our Young Employees Forum, Diversity and Inclusion Forum, Buro Happold Women's Network, and/or our Black at Buro Happold Employee Resource Groups

Ensure service and project work are carried out to an excellent standard and quality.
Your skills and experience
This role will require the following:
Coursework in Mechanical, Civil, Fire Protection or Architectural Engineering.
Familiarity with BIM modelling software, such as Revit and AutoCAD.
Internship experience at engineering related firm beneficial, and proven interest in the built environment and sustainable design practices.
Ability to communicate thoughts and technical ideas in an accessible manner.
Eagerness to learn and work as part of a multidisciplinary team.

title: Software Engineering Co-op - January 2026
location: Boston, MA, USA
targeted_major:

College of Science/Applied Physics

D'Amore-McKim School of Business/Supply Chain Management

description:
You must apply on NUworks and using the link given after submitting your application
Program Dates: January 5, 2026 - June 19, 2026
 The base pay for this position is $35/hour
 This is a Boston based opportunity with a 3 day in office expectation (Tuesday - Thursday) with 2 days remote (Monday and Friday)
  Who We Are: 
Our Engineering team within our Technology organization is building the future of home and looking for dynamic, hardworking and talented students to join us for a 6-month Co-op from January 5, 2026 - June 19, 2026. As a Software Engineering Co-op you will dive into a number of complex technical projects and gain a better understanding of our business. The Co-op program is designed to give you real work on your team, so you’ll be contributing to the goals of your team and making an impact.
  What You’ll Do: 
Work on individual and group projects focused on the full project life-cycle
Collaborate with business leaders and key stakeholders to brainstorm on how to solve challenges
Get  to a broad spectrum of technologies and programming languages
Improve your designs and jumpstart your learning  
Gain  access to technology/engineering leadership who want to hear your ideas
Participate in events with Co-ops across the business!
Receive professional development training to improve your soft and hard skills 
  What You’ll Need: 
Basic Qualifications:
Currently pursuing a Bachelor's degree in computer science or other related technical field, with the expectation that degree will be obtained between 2027 and 2028
Minimum GPA of 3.0
Able to commit to working 40 hours/week (9am-5pm, Monday-Friday) from January 5, 2026 to June 19, 2026
Must be returning to the course of study following completion of the Co-op
Preferred Qualifications:
Proven track record of strong academic performance
Experience with full stack and/or mobile development
Knowledge and experience working with object oriented programming languages
Experience or exposure to SQL, JavaScript and HTML, Python, HTML/CSS (this is not required for all teams) 
Interest in working with big data and machine learning
You enjoy autonomy and the opportunity to make a project or tool on your own
Strong communication skills
Strong comfort level and appetite to use AI in daily workflow
  Potential Team Placements Include: 
Supply Chain Retail Tech: This team develops the complex, ground-breaking logistics system to help move the products Wayfair sells from suppliers to warehouses to customers. Supply Chain is responsible for international transportation, warehouse management, and the customer delivery network making it all possible.
  Customer Technology: The Customer Technology organization at Wayfair is dedicated to building and optimizing the digital experiences that empower our customers throughout their journey, from initial inspiration to successful purchase. This team is structured into four key areas: 1) Growth, driving traffic and engagement through marketing tech and landing experiences, 2) Discovery, personalizing the user experience with our search engine and personalization features, 3) Purchase, optimizing conversion via cart, checkout, payments, and services, and 4) Platforms, building the foundational web and app infrastructure for our customer journeys.
  Why You’ll Love Wayfair:
Throughout the Co-op Program, we provide Co-ops with the opportunity to engage in social and community building activities including:
A calendar of events including social networking, professional development, and dialogue events with senior leaders
Formalized mentorship program along with an assigned reporting manager for impactful professional development and feedback
Skills-based training
Coffee chat opportunities for Co-ops to get to know one another 
  Purpose & Inclusion at Wayfair:
At Wayfair, we pride ourselves on fostering an environment where every individual experiences a fair and equitable employee journey. We are committed to developing targeted resources that raise awareness around inclusion and eliminate barriers, ensuring Wayfair provides a fair and inclusive workplace experience for everyone.

Social Impact & Responsibility:
At Wayfair, we focus on helping people on their journey to home - specifically those who have lost their way from home. We do this by leveraging our best assets, such as collaborating with leading nonprofit organizations, coordinating in-kind product donations, empowering our employees to get involved through paid volunteer time off programs, and encouraging our customers to donate. This multi-faceted approach allows us to support communities in need in authentic ways that align with Wayfair's broader mission of helping everyone, anywhere create their sense of home.
Assistance for Individuals with Disabilities
Wayfair is fully committed to providing equal opportunities for all individuals, including individuals with disabilities. As part of this commitment, Wayfair will make reasonable accommodations to the known physical or mental limitations of qualified individuals with disabilities, unless doing so would impose an undue hardship on business operations. If you require a reasonable accommodation to participate in the job application or interview process, please contact candidateaccommodations@wayfair.com.
 
Need Technical Assistance?
If you are having any technical difficulty submitting your application, please reach out to our careers team at careers@wayfair.com.
 
About Wayfair Inc.
Your personal data is processed in accordance with our Candidate Privacy Notice (https://www.wayfair.com/careers/privacy). If you have any questions or wish to exercise your rights under applicable privacy and data protection laws, please contact us at dataprotectionofficer@wayfair.com.

description:
Start designing tomorrow’s future!
Buro Happold has an exciting opportunity for a collaborative and enthusiastic Graduate ICT Engineer to join our welcoming and diverse workplace culture!
Here at Buro Happold, expect the exceptional.
From the projects you will work on to the clients we work with. From career-defining opportunities to an inclusive and diverse practice where we all contribute to a more equitable world. From our reputation to our relationships. Wherever your Buro Happold career takes you, it’ll be anything but ordinary.
Your next role
Join us and be surrounded by exceptional opportunities in an environment alive with innovation and possibility. Your new team has a willingness and curiosity to see possibility and potential in everything – from the most iconic projects to our everyday conversations. 
Learn more about ICT at Buro Happold
Your key duties: As a Graduate ICT Engineer, you will collaborate with architects and engineers to develop creative, energy-efficient buildings that provide aesthetics to their physical surroundings and utility to their occupants.  
Undertake detailed ICT engineering building services design and calculations (using software and knowledge to verify robust calculations)
Embrace the latest technologies and trends to improve performance and sustainability
Prepare technical book specifications and schedules, design development reports and innovative design solutions
Analyze telecommunications systems and assign circuitry for telecommunications devices.
Participate in Information and Communications Technology Team weekly meetings and perform ICT administrative tasks.
Support other engineers with CCTV, Access Control, Intrusion Detection and Audio- Visual system designs and drawings. 
Collaborate with other team members regarding telecommunications system designs and interoperability.  
Your skills and experience
This role will require the following:
Bachelor or Master’s Degree in Electrical or Architectural Engineering
Experience with Microsoft Office, Revit MEP, AutoCAD, or Project (preferred)
Familiarity with technical presentations and writing
Interest or experience in visual programming (Dynamo, Grasshopper), coding (Python, C#), or open source coding projects
The ability to multi-task, effectively manage time, and maintain ongoing project focus
Internship experience at an engineering-related firm (preferred) and proven interest in the built environment
What we offer:
Salary range of $73,000 to $80,000. This will be determined based on factors such as geographic location, skills, education, and/or experience
Generous benefits package
Annual discretionary bonus
Generous PTO (4 weeks) in addition to 10 paid holidays
401k with company match
Hybrid working & summer hours

title: Advisory Building Performance Intern
location:
Boston, MA, USA
New York, NY, USA
Washington, DC, USA
targeted_major:
College of Engineering/Environmental Engineering
College of Engineering/Electrical Engineering
College of Engineering/Civil Engineering
College of Engineering/Engineering and Public Policy
College of Science/Environmental Studies
College of Science/Environmental & Sustainability Sciences
College of Social Sciences & Humanities/Public Policy & Administration
description:
Start designing tomorrow’s future!
If you have an interest in the built environment and building performance in addition to policy and planning, ESG and sustainability, economics and revitalization, infrastructure and resilience, and/or climate action and decarbonization strategies and want to work with some of the world’s most innovative clients, Buro Happold has the perfect role for you. We are seeking a passionate intern to join our Advisory Building Performance Team on a full-time basis during summer 2026. This role can be based in Boston, New York, or Washington, D.C.! 
Here at Buro Happold, expect the exceptional.
From the projects you will work on to the clients we work with. From career-defining opportunities to an inclusive and diverse practice where we all contribute to a more equitable world. From our reputation to our relationships. Wherever your Buro Happold career takes you, it’ll be anything but ordinary.
Your next role
As an intern on our Advisory Building Performance Team, you will work on energy and whole-life carbon analysis for multi-scaled projects including high-performance buildings, campus, and cities, including projects featuring net-zero energy and carbon, Living Building Challenge certified projects, LEED certified projects, and calibrated modeling for performance based decarbonization upgrades.  You will work closely with our MEP engineers and sustainability and energy advisory experts and will be technically and creatively challenged on projects that include design support and innovation, strategy and policy development, high-performance strategies, materials research, energy, carbon, water and waste analysis and modelling, etc. From helping shape cities, to adapting infrastructure to deal with climate emergencies, a career at Buro Happold presents the chance to make a difference. 
Learn more about Advisory at Buro Happold
Your key duties:
Assist with whole building energy modeling and whole-life carbon analysis for building performance evaluation with industry standard software 
Evaluate resource consumption for sites and buildings across energy, water, and waste as well as evaluating GHG emissions and study opportunities to reduce impact and consumption  
Research sustainability and urban design strategies, best practices and benchmarks, policy advancements, and other topics   
Support building projects pursuing certification using a wide variety of building certification systems such as LEED, WELL, Fitwel, ILFI Zero Carbon, LBC, etc. or clients developing ESG strategies  
Help investigate preferred site strategies for stormwater management, external comfort, heat island reduction, improved air and acoustic quality, biodiversity and ecology, enhanced user experience 
Assess renewable energy production feasibility and research viable technologies and available funding and incentive opportunities.  
Create client PowerPoint presentations, memos, reports, graphics, and presentations
Your skills and experience
The successful candidate will be currently pursuing a bachelor or master’s degree in architectural Engineering, energy engineering, mechanical or civil engineering, urban planning & development, environmental engineering, Economics and Real Estate, Public Policy, environmental science or similar. We also expect you to have the following:
A passion for sustainability 
Experience using Revit, GIS, AutoCAD, or other design tools  
Graphic skills and experience using Adobe Creative Suite is preferred 
Proven interest in the built environment 
Ability to communicate thoughts and technical ideas in an accessible manner 
Eagerness to learn and work as part of a multidisciplinary team 
What we offer:
Hourly rate of $22 to $32 per hour depending on level of education and geographic location
Hybrid working & summer hours
Connection to global network of experts on the forefront of industry initiatives
Access to wide ranging learning and development opportunities
Be a part of supporting our diverse company culture through open engagement with our Young Employees Forum, Diversity and Inclusion Forum, Buro Happold Women's Network, and/or our Black at Buro Happold Employee Resource Groups
Learn more about our office locations

Ready for something a little less ordinary? 
Apply now to start your career journey with us.

description:
To be considered, please apply on our website!
At Bohler, we empower the ambitious to become the accomplished.  This greater purpose connects us with like-minded professionals, fosters meaningful relationships, and generates the alignment necessary to produce an unrivaled consulting and employment experience.
  We are looking for Staff Engineers who embodies this purpose.
  What You'll Do:
As a Staff Engineer at Bohler, you will:
Collaborate with team members to work on challenging land development projects in a fun, fast-paced environment
Hone your technical site design knowledge and "hands on" plan preparation experience
Design site plans for some of the most recognizable brand name clients across a wide spectrum of industries
Partner with your manager to tailor your career path towards YOUR vision
  What We Offer:
A supportive and flexible work environment that empowers employees to stay healthy, fulfill their passions, and balance work and life goals
The opportunity to take ownership of your career with an unsurpassed focus on career development and mentorship
A Learning & Development department that facilitates ongoing soft and technical skills training, including individualized AutoCAD training
Complete visibility and exposure to all aspects of a project
The opportunity to immerse yourself in the design process, while working hand-in-hand with team members
Open and transparent communication with senior leadership as well as local office management
Team building activities/events and a collaborative work environment
  What You'll Need:
The ability to learn quickly, strong communication skills, and a solid work ethic
A passion for design and creative problem-solving
A Bachelor's or Master's degree in Civil Engineering, or a related field
AutoCAD Civil 3D experience is a plus; but if you don't have it, we'll help you get it!
  Why Bohler 
Bohler provides land development consulting and site design services to owners and developers across all commercial, institutional, and residential markets. Our team of experts works closely with top real estate professionals to identify opportunities and create successful land development projects that transform communities.
  The Bohler Way
When driven people come together, the results are inspiring. Our unique culture, The Bohler Way, defines our values and the actions we take when we're at our best. It positions us to deliver on our purpose and creates an environment where motivated people relentlessly pursue growth and accomplishment.
  Bohler is an equal opportunity employer and affords equal opportunity to all applicants and employees for all positions without regard to race, color, religion, gender, national origin, age, disability, veteran status or any other status protected under local, state or federal laws.
To be considered, please apply on our website!
